Uses of Interface
com.rexsl.test.TestResponse

Packages that use TestResponse
com.rexsl.test RESTful client, for tests (but not only). 
com.rexsl.test.assertions Built-in assertions for TestResponse. 
 

Uses of TestResponse in com.rexsl.test
 

Methods in com.rexsl.test that return TestResponse
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertBody(org.hamcrest.Matcher<String> matcher)
          Verifies HTTP response body content against provided matcher, and throws AssertionError in case of mismatch.
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertHeader(String name, org.hamcrest.Matcher<Iterable<String>> matcher)
          Verifies HTTP header against provided matcher, and throws AssertionError in case of mismatch.
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertJson(String element)
          Verifies the Json data against the element identifier argument, and throws AssertionError in case of mismatch.
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertStatus(int status)
          Verifies HTTP response status code against the provided absolute value, and throws AssertionError in case of mismatch.
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertStatus(org.hamcrest.Matcher<Integer> matcher)
          Verifies HTTP response status code against the provided matcher, and throws AssertionError in case of mismatch.
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertThat(AssertionPolicy assertion)
          Assert something (AssertionError will be thrown if assertion fails).
 TestResponse TestResponse.assertXPath(String xpath)
          Verifies HTTP response body XHTML/XML content against XPath query, and throws AssertionError in case of mismatch.
 TestResponse TestClient.get(String description)
          Execute GET request.
 TestResponse TestClient.post(String description, Object body)
          Execute POST request.
 TestResponse TestClient.put(String description, Object body)
          Execute PUT request.
 TestResponse TestResponse.registerNs(String prefix, Object uri)
          Register additional namespace prefix for XPath.
 

Methods in com.rexsl.test with parameters of type TestResponse
 void AssertionPolicy.assertThat(TestResponse response)
          Make an assertion and return nothing or throw AssertionError if some problem is found.
